messages.messageBody:
**> My children's writing list has been talking about
> >this book.

I think I missed this what book was this.

**

I posted a question about a book about a foster kid living with an
eccentric homeschooling family, titled Surviving the Applewhites. It
was just published this year, I haven't read it yet but will look for it
at the library, and I wondered if anyone else had read it.

Betsy

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Book about wacky homeschoolers
messages.msgSnippet: ... It s a yahoo list for people who write or want to write for children. childrens-writers-subscribe@yahoogroups.com will get you subbed if you re interested.
messages.messageBody:
>
> What is a writing list?
> Joanne

It's a yahoo list for people who write or want to write for children.
childrens-writers-subscribe@yahoogroups.com will get you subbed if you're
interested. Watch out! It's even higher traffic than this list. <g>
There are hundreds of lists for writers of all kinds.
Tia

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Book about wacky homeschoolers
messages.msgSnippet: ... My children s writing list has been talking about this book.  I think it just won a Newbery award.  Some folks didn t think much of it.  I didn t see any
messages.messageBody:
> I've read a couple of blurbs about a book, by Stephanie Tolan, about a
> wacky family of creative homeschoolers. (I think it was a selected as a
> Newbery honor book. The book is called Surviving the Applewhites. Has
> anyone read it? It looks like it's only available in hardback right now.

My children's writing list has been talking about this book. I think it
just won a Newbery award. Some folks didn't think much of it. I didn't see
any mention of homeschooling in connection with it. Our library has it on
order, so I'll have to wait to see.
Tia

messages.subject: Book about wacky homeschoolers
messages.msgSnippet: I ve read a couple of blurbs about a book, by Stephanie Tolan, about a wacky family of creative homeschoolers.  (I think it was a selected as a Newbery honor
messages.messageBody:
I've read a couple of blurbs about a book, by Stephanie Tolan, about a
wacky family of creative homeschoolers. (I think it was a selected as a
Newbery honor book. The book is called Surviving the Applewhites. Has
anyone read it? It looks like it's only available in hardback right now.

Betsy
